Please inquire about our Private rooms on your next visit. You can also specify private room seating with your next reservation to confirm availability. 
Owner: Johnny Kao 
 Executive Chef: Chen-Hua Yan
 Management Team: Edward Cheung, John Fong, Henry Lieu
 Date Opened: February 28, 1998
 Concept Architect: Greg Olving In China, cooking is an ancient art rather than simply a nourishing necessity. Those dishes, which have stood the test of time, provide us with what is known as the classic Chinese cuisine. A well-planned meal will vary in texture and color as well as flavor and temperature to achieve overall harmony in the tradition of Ying and Yang. Each of the four main regions of the country has developed its own distinctive culinary style. Peking (North) provides a tender, delicate taste while Shanghai (East) uses light and savory flavors. In contrast are the crispy, unusual blends of Canton (South) and the fiery, spicy seasonings of Hunan and Szechwan (Central and West). To provide New York City, Capital of the World, with the best China has to offer, Mr. Ks has meticulously searched for dishes representing the essence of each of these regions. The most gourmet recipes with the best ingredients and subtlest of seasonings have been prepared under the masterful direction of our head chef. Their beautiful presentation on imperial flatware, served in grand style, is an exotic prelude to your delight.", "primary_category": "Chinese Restaurants", "number_of_ratings": 29}, "googleplaces": {"link": "https://maps.google.com/?cid=9607342797139092867", "rating": 3.9, "number_of_reviews": 68}}

Fresh is in our knowledge:

Fresh is in our commitment:

We cook our meat over Post Oak wood in specially designed pits. No gas is used for cooking our meat. All of the smoke flavor and the distinctive smoke ring are genuine. In addition, we make our own 100% beef sausage using the same recipe we have used for over 20 years. We grill fresh meat 7 days a week from brisket, chicken, turkey and pork ribs to our own home made sausage links. It's not ALL about Bar-B-Que. Our experienced long-time employees make delicious cole slaw, potato salad and pinto beans along with individual pecan pies and Texas size brownies. We have the perfect side dishes to compliment the best Bar-B-Que you'll ever experience. You may have heard of our distinctive Luling City Market Bar-Q-Que sauce. This tangy mustard based sauce has been one of our most popular items and we ship it all over the world. Our special sauce is so good you can use it on everything from meat, eggs and seafood to just plain old crackers. We make it here from a special recipe - you can't get it anywhere else, but you CAN get it from us. Click the 'Sauce' link above for more details.", "primary_category": "Restaurants", "number_of_ratings": 57}, "googleplaces": {"link": "https://maps.google.com/?cid=4103657979112254522", "rating": 3.9, "number_of_reviews": 200}}

Red Devil is a family owned and operated restaurant that offers an authentic taste of Italy. 
Since 1960 we have been committed to excellence in food service. Joe and Mike Digeno are the second generation owners of the restaurant and they take their reputation seriously, continuing the rich tradition of quality that Joe Digeno Sr. began over 50 years ago. 
 
 
We provide food service for dine-in, take-out, and delivery, as well as special event catering. With five convenient Valley locations we're not too far from your work or home. We are located near the intersections of 32nd Street and McDowell Road, 32nd Street and Bell Road, Mill Avenue & Southern, 83rd Ave & Union Hills and our new location in Pinetop, off the White Mountain Blvd.  
 
 
Our extensive menu includes Portobello Mushroom Ravioli, Chicken Picatta,Seafood Marinara, Pollo Basil, Shrimp Alfredo, Sausage & Peppers, and many others.

At the site of his debauched death, various portraits of the poet hang on the dark-paneled walls while indifferent regulars focus on the task at hand: The White Horse has stayed in operation since 1880 by serving its customers--before Thomas and after--one drink at a time.The FoodIn our health-conscious century, though, we know it's as likely to be the pub grub as the booze that does you in. Nonetheless, White Horse's full-flavored burgers, delectable grilled chicken sandwich and slab-cut fries are worthy of poetic excesses--and perhaps even early death. Brehon is located near downtown Chicago at the corner of Wells and Superior streets in the heart of the historic River North neighborhood.   
 
Brehon Pub has proudly been a River North establishment since 1980.  Enjoy our full dinner and lunch menus at our spacious bar, pub tables, outdoor seating, or new dining area.   
 
Brehon Pub offers a great venue to watch Blackhawks games, gather with co-workers, celebrate a special occasion, or catch up with friends.

We cook our meat over Post Oak wood in specially designed pits. No gas is used for cooking our meat. All of the smoke flavor and the distinctive smoke ring are genuine. In addition, we make our own 100% beef sausage using the same recipe we have used for over 20 years. We grill fresh meat 7 days a week from brisket, chicken, turkey and pork ribs to our own home made sausage links. It's not ALL about Bar-B-Que. Our experienced long-time employees make delicious cole slaw, potato salad and pinto beans along with individual pecan pies and Texas size brownies. We have the perfect side dishes to compliment the best Bar-B-Que you'll ever experience. You may have heard of our distinctive Luling City Market Bar-Q-Que sauce. This tangy mustard based sauce has been one of our most popular items and we ship it all over the world. Our special sauce is so good you can use it on everything from meat, eggs and seafood to just plain old crackers. We make it here from a special recipe - you can't get it anywhere else, but you CAN get it from us. Click the 'Sauce' link above for more details.", "primary_category": "Restaurants", "number_of_ratings": 57}, "googleplaces": {"link": "https://maps.google.com/?cid=4103657979112254522", "rating": 3.9, "number_of_reviews": 200}}

The food is good and reasonably priced. There's no particular ambiance. Usually the service is very good but our waitress last week couldn't have been less attentive. She took our order only after we called her over and acted like we were boring her.She never brought the appetizer because she'd forgotten to put it in the computer. Nor did she apologize. She was the opposite of customer friendly. We would return, but would insist that we have a different waitress.", "rating": "4", "source": "opentable", "author_name": "Ricki", "individual_ratings": {"Valor": "3", "Comida": "4", "Ambiente": "3", "Servicio": "1"}}, {"tags": "Casual", "text": "I  enjoy the Turkish food and the friendly, warm atmosphere. My only criticism is that the tiki I, the \"planner\" of virtually all our evenings out, found very sparse; in fact, it was the most meager drink I've had at any of New York's many Turkish restaurants. I thought the place was ok when I went the first time, but the second time I had a very rude experience. I ordered the gyro sandwich, my friend got the alexander gyro plate. When she saw her plate was gyro meat drenched in tomato sauce with a side of plain yogurt, she asked if she could change her plate. Now, the sauce just tasted weird to us, maybe someone else would like it, but for about $17 it is not worth it. When she told the waiter she looked so shocked and annoyed, like it was the first time someone asked for a plate change. She said we don't do that, unless their is something wrong with the food. Ok... She said she would ask the manager if they could. The manager said we could change it, but still have to pay the same price. No, the meal we wanted was cheaper. It's not like we are trying to get free food, we didn't even touch the other plate. They were so rude about it, and looked at us in disbelief. My friend got angry and wasn't rude. She told the waiter that this restaurant will do anything to \"cut cost\" and that they would lose a customer. This is not the first time we've eaten at a restaurant. They were so rude, that we just wanted to pay our tab, even without the food and leave. She ended changing the order and telling us we didn't have to pay the difference, but still they were acting like they were doing us a favor. We brought our business to you. We get our check and our food to go. The man starts clearing the table while we are talking and snatches the plates and olive oil. He was extremely rude and was acting as if he was trying to teach us a lesson. We paid our tab and left. Long story short, the people are very rude here. They act as if you're doing them favor by eating at their place. You're not! And the food is extremely dry. You need a gallon of water to digest your meal. I will never eat there again. I just want to save people from dealing with such a rude interaction.", "rating": 1, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105516881327488229096/reviews", "author_name": "Zahra Farah"}, {"text": "Great atmosphere and the food was excellent. ", "rating": 5, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102843684223721179334/reviews", "author_name": "Doug Anderson"}, {"text": "I loved the original Mr. K's in Washington, DC and had gone for years until they closed a few years ago.  I was delighted to discover the NYC location while visiting a client's office and decided to have dinner here at the earliest opportunity.  The good was exactly as I remembered it: delicious! I had the crispy beef as an appetizer followed by the Peking duck.  The duck was skillfully carved table-side and wrapped in a crepe on a bed of lettuce and a touch of hoisin sauce.  The skin was perfectly crisp and the meat juicy.  It sort of melts in your mouth.  In between the appetizer and main course, we were presented with a citrus sorbet to cleanse our palates, a refined detail that most upscale restaurants should reintroduce to their service repertoire.  I'm looking forward to my next visit here, which will be soon!

You don't have to wait for a very long time to get your pizzas.", "title": "", "rating": 5, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "Stephen S."}, {"date": "November 3, 2013", "text": "We were doing a little pub crawl down Vermont last night....but it stopped here.  We sat at the bar with Heather from NYC. She was great fun.  This place takes me out of LA. Very unassuming, charming...like my boyfriend said, it reminds you of the place you went with the family for your 1st Communion. (You Catholics know what I mean!)

As soon as we sat down at the bar, we had a few slices of pizza in front of us.  We grabbed a table for dinner, and split the veggie lasagna. The cheese pasta sauce ratio was perfect, and the sauce is great.  To his dismay, it was full of mushrooms.  But, I enjoyed those, he picked them out, and LOVED this dish.  Plenty to split.  The traditional garlic bread and house salads are a great start as well.  

I wish they had a better wine by the glass selection, next time I'll order a bottle. And we'll get the pizza next time.

The sweet bartender got us a slice of tiramisu to split, maybe to welcome me to the neighborhood?  It was a really nice touch!

Overall, we'll go back again. On a cheat day. Heavy delish traditional comfort food. Glad we walked home. ", "title": "", "rating": 4, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "Christine R."}, {"date": "April 21, 2014", "text": "Good food. I said to my self \"wow that was fast!\" As I'm sitting there the same two waiters are just grabbing people and telling them to sit down in different tables. They was Preety much trying to fill up that section. One of them was being rude to a Spanish lady because he didn't understand her and dismissed her. A party of 7 people arrived and they tried to squeeze them in a very tight corner. One of the waiters kept forgetting to bring me the glass of water I asked and gave me attitude when I asked for a refill of the complimentary salad.", "rating": 1, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/106807821254173100076/reviews", "author_name": "Infamous Haz3"}, {"text": "The waiters were nice but our server seemed so out of it; I had asked him for lemon slices (for my water) but it never came. They gave me another plate of lasagna after I asked, which was nice but then our server mixed up mine and my friends cards when we paid so I ended up paying for his meal instead. For a restaurant located in Times Square with a wait time of an hour, this seems kind of bizarre. The crust and the sauce was so flavorful. We ordered the spicy ravioli as an appetizer and it was okay. It wasn't nasty, it just wasn't our thing. The manager came by to ask how things were and we told her the pizza was amazing and the ravioli okay. She generously took off the ravioli from our tickets because she said "Barry wouldn't want a customer to pay for something they didn't enjoy". We thought it was the sweetest gesture. The pizzas we ordered were deep dish and excellent.

We came here on a weekday and there was a fair amount of parking available. We were seated fairly quickly. The service was very friendly and efficient. The restaurant is very casual and has a homey feel.

We ordered:
Mediterranean Pizza: We all liked this pizza better. Very good ingredients and taste.
Margherita Pizza: This pizza was also good but over shadowed by the Mediterranean Pizza

Overall I would come back here but would not seek it out.", "rating": 5, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/115625328098738453545/reviews", "author_name": "Nikhil Pai"}]}}

It's family tradition to come for graduation lunches and dinners. The family favorite has always been pan fried noodles with seafood, but don't think that you could go wrong with anything on their menu. We always eat family style here, and share plates and bowls of rice. They have a nice hot tea selection, and offer dim sum on the weekend (they come around with various carts of food and you can choose to partake or not). Service has always been great, but be aware that they will not seat incomplete parties. There was a melodic 3 piece jazz band playing when we arrived. It was still happy hour so we ordered some fruity cocktails we usually wouldn't order. They were pretty terrible. There were big ice chuncks in my drink, and the flavor profiles were just wrong. They did get bonus points for having bone marrow on the menu. It was fantastic! The greens and onion crunchies served with it complimented the rich marrow beautifully. We split the short rib entree; it was dry. We also got the app with tomatoes, fruit and cheese, I forget the name. It was good, plenty to share for more than 2. Then the waiter spilled food on my boyfriends suit coat... The manger rushed over, apologized profusely, comped our entire meal, and asked us to send the dry cleaning bill! I was impressed. We didn't send to cleaning bill, that was too much. However, it was a bummer because we were there to eat before going out to a show. A very parkour approach to table service. Perhaps I mis-ordered as one menu feature is any salad with a host of protein toppers, which was tempting.The roast chicken, which I would presume is a specialty, was bland and sadly dry. All of our meals were delicious. Two people ordered the Dine LA menu. Since there was so much food they shared bites with the rest of us. They were tender and cooked just right.", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "July 17, 2015", "author_name": "Sushilover", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"text": "Our hostess was very nice and gave us 2 glasses of rose. She also gave us a nice table but then our waiter was not very friendly which was a bit off putting. The food was not served as anticipated. The fois gras I ordered was warm and practically melting on top of a sweet sauce that was tasty but was far too much . Notably the arugula salad was quite good. They didn't have a menu for kids either but we got by with basic pasta with cheese. Not the most inventive. Wine served was average and the waiter served us the wrong glasses stating mine was the reisling but after taking just a tiny sniff could tell it was the Chardonnay my husband had ordered. Relating to dessert, they had a waffle on the menu but we're told they were out of it. As it was the first serving of dinner I inquired as to how it could be that they were out of it already. Our new waitress, why we had a new one I don't know why, said it was actually probably going to be taken off the menu because they've been out for a few days now. Oh and let me say we couldn't find our original waiter when it was time for dessert. In addition, the GM was obliviant to what was going on. We were however pleasantly surprised after ordering a dessert (Nutella crime brûlée, which is nothing like a real creme brûlée) and my husband who is French found it inedible, they kindly subtracted it from the bill. It was a mixed bag but after all was said and done and the bill was $140, it wasn't worth the experience.", "rating": "3", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "July 16, 2015", "author_name": "Momoagogo", "individual_ratings": {"food": "3", "service": "3", "ambience": "4"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Great for Lunch, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List, Romantic, Special Occasion", "text": "I came into the restaurant not knowing that it had a new owner and concept. The wine list was also impressive as it contained not only familiar names and varietals, but some names I don't regularly see. They just were written up in Wine Spectator, so you know they're doing something right! The food was impeccable. I strongly suggest the Hamachi Crudo, the Steak Tartare, and the Foie Gras. Our sea scallops were perfect as were both the greens and the avocado side dishes. Service was flawless. Truly this place has reached a new height. Compliments to the chef and management. Make sure you check out this fantastic option on the Westside. It's a tucked away little gem with a rustic, romantic vibe. I loved the ambiance created by the outdoor fire place, distressed wood finishes, and soft lighting. The service is attentive and helpful, and I really liked their sommelier. We started with the oysters - fabulous - and had their two house specialties - black cod and sea scallops. I found the black cod decadent and delightful, actually better than the scallops. The restaurant also has private rooms that can be used for larger gatherings; I think a rehearsal dinner or something was going on when we were there. We definitely plan to return to the Roost, and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys farm-to-table dining and casual elegance.", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "March 7, 2015", "author_name": "NikeSwim", "individual_ratings": {"food": "4", "service": "4", "ambience": "5"}}, {"text": "I had the rotisseries chicken and it was tough, no gravy, dry, no flavor and the skin was soggy - no way this was cooked on a rotisserie - really disappointing", "rating": "2", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "March 6, 2015", "author_name": "Susan", "individual_ratings": {"food": "1", "service": "2", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Neighborhood Gem, Romantic", "text": "We can't wait to return. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a romantic date. I would do it all over if I could! I did ask for a table by the fire pit, which they did not follow through with. That would be my only complaint. Besides that, everything was great!", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "February 14, 2015", "author_name": "Kent", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Neighborhood Gem, Special Occasion", "text": "My wife and I have been eating paleo having just finished a Whole 30 diet for a month. The Roost at LA Farm had tons of options from Gluten Free to Vegetarian. The hard part of a paleo diet is jazzing up food. My wife had the scallops and I had the pork belly. We loved the meal and said that we would be back before the end of the year. You can tell when a restaurant bends over backwards to provide a wonderful meal with alternative diets and they excel at it!", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "February 14, 2015", "author_name": "Skibby", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "4"}}, {"tags": "Good for Groups, Great for Lunch, Neighborhood Gem", "text": "We went for lunch. The service was great; attentive and friendly. We were surprisingly in and out within an hour.", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "February 12, 2015", "author_name": "WJJB", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Good for Groups, Great for Outdoor Dining, Hot Spot, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List, Romantic, Special Occasion", "text": "My husband and I had gone with a group of friends to The Roost at LA Farm for New Years Eve dinner, and what we had that evening was delicious. We wanted to return for our Valentine's Day dinner (early because of work). We arrived, were greeted kindly by the hostess, shown to our table in one of two beautiful covered garden areas right by a fire. The menu is varied, lots of options, so many delicious sounding things that we actually ended up ordering the "Trust Johnny" which is a tasting menu (5 or 7 courses) that the chef may model off the menu or may throw in some wild cards. Our first course was a delicious toasted crostini with smoked salmon, caviar and egg which was just a delectable way to start the meal- tasted so fresh. The we received a delicious lobster pasta with broccoli and a touch of cream in the sauce. It was very rich in flavor without being too heavy. The third course was sort of pork two ways. We had an absolutely to die for pork belly served with greens and apples marinated in Calvados. I actually forget what part of the pork the other way was, however I remember it being delicious and served with pillowy perfect gnocchi. And last of the entrees was the duck breast, which was succulent and wonderfully cooked, served with fried duck gizzards (which I can honestly say is not something I would have sought out, but was incredibly happy it was put on my plate). The waiter and chef were nice enough to oblige my request for two different types of dessert. I had a delicious well made chocolate brownie with a decadent chocolate ice cream on the side, and my husband had a delicious apple cobbler that was not too sweet and just perfect. We will definitely be back, and will continue to trust Johnny.", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "February 10, 2015", "author_name": "NomNomNom", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Special Occasion", "text": "At the time we went, it was quiet and quick. Went at 6 pm from the SF valley. The 405 was moving. We had an 8pm show at the Geffen in Westwood. Oysters, tuna tartar and scallops, were all very tasty. The price was right because of a Restaurant.com offer. Will do it again.", "rating": "4", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "February 7, 2015", "author_name": "Chuckie", "individual_ratings": {"food": "4", "service": "5", "ambience": "4"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies", "text": "my husband and I had a great time! smart looking restaurant with great service. we tried the tasting menu and wine pairing, which was the way to go. the manager was serving up some fantatic wines with our dinner which was incredible!! great music as well, not boring restaurant backround noise, actual quality music! we will be back, great local find.", "rating": "5", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "January 31, 2015", "author_name": "ashley79", "individual_ratings": {"food": "5", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies", "text": "Very nice quiet place. Said happy birthday to our friend but I thought there would be a candle on the dessert and there wasn't.Ordered medium rare burger, it came well done with lukewarm fries. When the waiter asked I showed him and he offered to change it but I declined. Still it was very flavorful.My friends got lost, we waited about 15 minutes. The service was very slow also--consequently, I was charged a bit over $5 dollars at the parking kiosk after giving a $5 tip to valet. I had no idea there was a 2 hour limit on parking, no one mentioned this.All in all, the atmosphere is wonderful, but I wouldn't go back.", "rating": "3", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "January 20, 2015", "author_name": "Georgia", "individual_ratings": {"food": "3", "service": "2", "ambience": "5"}}, {"tags": "Fit for Foodies, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List", "text": "I read previous reviews and I must say that they aren't completely correct. Some good, some bad. Overall, we had a very nice dining experience. Very good food with service that still needs some polishing. I say, give it a try and decide for yourself. Oh, and the reviewer who said parking is impossible, not sure of the time of day they went, but it couldn't be easier.", "rating": "3", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "January 16, 2015", "author_name": "opentablevip", "individual_ratings": {"food": "4", "service": "3", "ambience": "4"}}, {"text": "Good enough food for the average eater, but not what it once was. Given the location (Santa Monica/Westside) for a similar price point you could find better alternatives. While we really like it, we probably won't be back for a while.", "rating": "4", "source": "opentable", "posted_at": "January 2, 2015", "author_name": "Runyandinner", "individual_ratings": {"food": "3", "service": "5", "ambience": "5"}}, {"text": "I wish I had come on a night when the kitchen was fully prepared.Four of us went on NYE for their 7-course prie-fixe menu. We were seated 30 minutes after our reservation time, but that was fine - we expected that considering it was NYE. Our first course was served around 10p.m.; the seventh at 2a.m. We had to wait one hour after the 1st course to receive our 2nd course. The paired wine would often come after we finished eating the course, so it almost seemed irrelevant. We felt sorry for the wait-stuff-- they were working hard and running around apologizing profusely. I would recommend this place and/or come back again if I felt like we were compensated better for our time there. We started with the calamari - served in a way I'd never had before - sauteed and stuffed. Incredible. Ended the meal with bananas foster (definitely enough to share). The outdoor seating by the fountain is nice.", "quote": "Food was ok", "rating": "3", "source": "tripadvisor", "author_name": "Inka335", "posted_from_mobile": false, "relative_date_found": "April 16, 2017"}], "yellowpages": [{"date": "February 25, 2009", "text": "Being the first review for the Billy Goat Tavern, I definitely have to put a little thought into this review.  

Located in sub-Michigan, the metal sign for this place is easily missed, found at the top of some stairs across the street from the Tribune building on Michigan Ave.  The place is definitely old school Chicago, has had crowds of customers for years and carries with it an interesting story.  

Upon entering, you are greeted by shouts for your order...order a hamburger, they ask if you want a cheeseburger...ask for a single, they ask if you want a double.  No fries, chips... No Pepsi, coke. Ask for water...well, you get the flow.  Free refills...and go for a double cheese. 

The burgers are not expensive, but not really cheap. They are heavy on the bun, but I like the fact that you can put your own toppings and condiments. And of course, you'll find your own seats. They do have a bar, which is nice if you want to grab a real drink and watch a game that might be on. 

This place is classic Chicago... it is even famously associated with the Chicago Cubs... since the original owner supposedly was the one that "cursed" the Cubs...long story, so definitely feel free to ask them.  The staff is really nice!  And because of their relation to the Cubs history, this place draws in a ton of tourists, so the staff will take pictures, answer questions, etc. 

Just a great experience and a scheduled stop everytime I make it into town.  ", "title": "Great Chicago Experience", "rating": 4, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "Lee D."}], "googleplaces": [{"text": "I just returned from eating at this place. I WOULD APPRECIATE IT IF ANY OF THE PEOPLE WHO REVIEWED THIS BAR and/or ANY FUTURE REVIEWS SIMILAR TO THE ONES MADE SUCH AS MINE WOULD PROVIDE ME WITH A WAY TO CONTACTING THEM.  Your name will not be released to the bar, it is only for the detective and lawyer so that they can speak to you.  THIS BAR WILL BE HELD ACCOUNTABLE, I GUARANTEE IT.\r\n\r\n\r\nSTAY AWAY.  My son's girlfriend was groped and sexually harassed by what appears to be a regular.  This regular then told the bouncers that my son was bothering him, when in fact it was the other way around.  My son did not strike anyone, lay his hand on anyone, was not drunk, was not disorderly.  He and his girlfriend were led quietly outside by the three bouncers who then proceeded to rip off his gold chain (robbery) and his shirt.  THEY THEN PROCEEDED TO HANDCUFF MY SON AND HIS GIRLFRIEND.  Once handcuffed my son was beat up by these three individuals, we have cell phone pictures.  My son was kicked in the feat, chest, back, scratched on his face all with handcuffs on.  Who has handcuffs I ask, you know the answer to that one.  Let me tell the bar owner, if you think by doing this outside your business you can not be prosecuted think again.  Your employees did this.  You have a history of problems at your business. We are initiating legal action against this bar.  My son could have been killed, the emotional scars will be the hardest to remove.  You are a bunch of cowards and egomaniacs and I look forward to seeing you in court.  As a mother, I am disgusted by the behavior of this bar and I warn all of you out there, don't waste a cent on this dive.  STAY AWAY!!!", "title": "STAY AWAY. "Townies" congregate at Irma's!!", "quote": "BEST Mexican food in town!", "rating": "5", "source": "tripadvisor", "author_name": "Renee C", "posted_from_mobile": false, "relative_date_found": "July 10, 2017"}], "googleplaces": [{"text": "I have been a vendor at the Quilt Show in Houston for ten years now and every year we come to Irmas Original with a group of 10-20 people. Irma and her family are so excited to see us even though we only come that one night each year. One year our shuttle didnt show us to bring us back to our hotel because we closed the place down after hours. So Irmas sons offered to drive us all back in their personal vehicles. 

Its true, they dont have a menu, dont give you the prices ahead of time and it is not cheap, we are never disappointed with the food, drinks, service and getting the opportunity for Irma to come out and greet us and take pictures with us all. She even offers some free dishes to try out. 

Our group every year grows and grows and we all look forward to this wonderful night at Irmas every year. If I lived in Houston I would go often. I have recommended Irmas Original to many people, even our customers who live in town. Since coming, Irmas sons have opened two other restaurants in town. They have also expanded the space in the restaurant but we love being seated in the back original restaurant (and bathroom) with all of the eclectic decor that makes you feel like you are home. 

Thank you, Irma, for treating us like family every year. We all will be back! Matter of fact I need to make a reservation for 16 in your back room please, for Thursday, November 2. 

God bless you!", "rating": 5, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/114199841770629928951/reviews", "author_name": "Louise van Broekhuizen"}, {"text": "Absolutely loved this place.  Wife and I stopped in after driving around on beautiful day with top down on convertible.  

We were greeted immediately and told to choose any table (went around 5pm on a Saturday).  Gentleman came up and told us we needed to try the homemade lemonade!  It was wonderful.

He then suggested some of the homemade enchiladas with shrimp and tamales.  Charro beans were the best I have ever had.  Food was amazing.  Atmosphere great and laid back.  Watched a little football and enjoyed the afternoon.

Irma came out to greet us and thanked us for stopping by.", "rating": 5, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102310374623305601872/reviews", "author_name": "Chris Bowie"}, {"text": "Family owned and operated. ", "title": "", "rating": 5, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "Theo T."}, {"date": "August 25, 2010", "text": "Saw this pub on a TV show I watched..."Diners, Drive Ins, and DIves" on the Food network. Having grown up in England, I may be a little spoiled, eventhough British food would qualify more as comfort food rather than culianry wizardry... I have looked forward to this evening for the past 2 weeks as I have been in Houston on business. Last night I started the evening with a nice English "London" pint. Pretty good.
My appitizer was a curry pastry item for $10. I ate one of the 3.
My meal was Shephards Pie, which was featured on the show. It was mediorce at best. Certainly not what Grandma in England, made or what I make for that matter. My business associate had the Fish and Chips. The batter was not crispy, and the taste was reasonably bland. Either this was an off night all the way around, or my faith in "Drive-ins, Diners and Dives" will not be so compelling.
The atmosphere was just as a pub should be. the service was good...The food for a $35 meal was not. Thank you. I may go back...but it will strictly be to get a good English Pint.", "title": "Not everything it is cracked up to be...", "rating": 1, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "Lee F."}, {"date": "August 11, 2007", "text": "Terribly Management", "title": "Poor Management", "rating": 1, "source": "yellowpages", "author_name": "dlblansett"}], "googleplaces": [{"text": "Neat British-style pub. We got sit on their patio as the cold front came and tables had little fires going in th middle of them. It was very cozy and romantic. 

We had this fish and chips and the chicken tikka masala. The fish and chips were very good and the chips themselves were the best I've ever had. The chicken Tikka masala was absolutely delicious. It had a little bit of heat to it but not too much. The flavor was excellent and the rice was cooked perfectly. It also came with some naan which was pretty good. 

The entrees average at a little over $20, but the portions are large and so far the food has been excellent. We will definitely be returning.", "rating": 5, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103764140844242262959/reviews", "author_name": "Rebeka Dunsmore"}, {"text": "Great patio, which allows dogs, Tv for sports games and a giant plate of fish and chips for those who are interested.", "rating": 4, "source": "googleplaces", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/104108282015705936528/reviews", "author_name": "Shannon LaDuke"}]}}

It was then and remains a great place for delicious beers.  The atmosphere is lively and people all seem to be having a good time.  While the beer is great, the food is somewhat lacking - the burgers are great but as for the mussels -- not so much.  The first time I was there I had the mussels with wine which were cooked well but nothing extraordinary.  This time I tired the mussels with beer - the broth was very bland, could not discern any beer flavor at all (or garlic or other herbs for tat matter) and they were a bit overcooked.
